item.title: American Ben Ogden wins silver, breaking 50 year medal drought for U.S. men's cross-country skiing
item.description: Ben Ogden of Vermont skied powerfully, finishing just behind Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo of Norway. It was the first Olympic medal for a U.S. men's cross-country skier since 1976.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: An ape, a tea party — and the ability to imagine
item.description: The ability to imagine — to play pretend — has long been thought to be unique to humans. A new study suggests one of our closest living relatives can do it too.

item.title: DHS faces funding deadline. And, courts fast-track Somali asylum seeker hearings
item.description: Congress has until Friday to reach a deal to fund the Department of Homeland Security. And, several asylum cases filed by Somali migrants in immigration courts were suddenly fast-tracked.

item.title: In a world built for sitting, here's how to stay active — even when stuck inside
item.description: In the office, classroom and living room, working and relaxing mean sitting still. Our bodies evolved without chairs. Here are some tips for getting out of your seat and moving — even on cold days.

item.description: People in poor countries often get little or no warning about floods, storms and other deadly weather. Local efforts are changing that, and saving lives.

item.title: Hospitals are posting prices for patients. It's mostly industry using the data
item.description: The Trump administration pushed for price transparency in health care. But instead of patients shopping for services, it's mostly health systems and insurers using the information for negotiations.
